revised_title: Anatomy and Nomenclature of the Shoulder Girdle in Sauropterygia
tldr: The author examines the shoulder girdle and clavicular arch in Sauropterygia, providing a detailed analysis of the bones and their nomenclature. The study suggests that the precoracoid element of the shoulder girdle was cartilaginous in Ichthyosaurus and that this cartilage usually articulated with the scapula and coracoids, completing the precoracoid foramen anteriorly.
